classes.name: AntSelectionFeedbackPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.AntSelectionFeedbackPolicy

Provide support for selecting and positioning a non-resizable figure. Selection is indicated via rectangular handle that outlines the figure with a 1-pixel black dotted line.

constructor.name: AntSelectionFeedbackPolicy

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new Router object

functions.name: onSelect
functions.description: Called by the framework of the Policy should show a resize handle for the given shape

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: the responsible canvas

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: the figure to decorate with a selection feedback

functions.name: moved
functions.description: Callback if the figure has been moved

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: the unselected figure

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Called by the host if the policy has been installed.

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Called by the host if the policy has been uninstalled.

functions.name: onDragStart
functions.description:
Called by the framework if the related shape has init a drag&drop operation

The Policy can send a veto to prevent the DragDrop operation

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The host canvas

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: The related figure

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: shiftKey
parameters.description: true if the shift key has been pressed during this event

parameters.name: ctrlKey
parameters.description: true if the ctrl key has been pressed during the event

returns.description: return false to send a veto to the drag operation

functions.name: onDrag
functions.description: Called by the framework during drag a figure.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The host canvas

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: The related figure

functions.name: onDragEnd
functions.description: Called by the framework if the drag drop operation ends.

parameters.name: canvas
parameters.description: The host canvas

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: The related figure

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: shiftKey
parameters.description: true if the shift key has been pressed during this event

parameters.name: ctrlKey
parameters.description: true if the ctrl key has been pressed during the event

functions.name: adjustPosition
functions.description: Adjust the coordinates to the rectangle/region of this constraint.

functions.name: adjustDimension
functions.description: ensure that the dimension didn't goes outside the given restrictions

functions.name: onRightMouseDown
functions.description:
Called if the user press the right mouse on the figure.
You can either override the "onContextMenu" method of the figure or install an editor policy and override this method. Booth is valid and possible.

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: the figure below the mouse

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the mouse down event

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the mouse down event

parameters.name: shiftKey
parameters.description: true if the shift key has been pressed during this event

parameters.name: ctrlKey
parameters.description: true if the ctrl key has been pressed during the event

functions.name: attr
functions.description:
Read or set object attributes.
When no value is given, reads specified attribute from the element.
When value is given, sets the attribute to that value. Multiple attributes can be set by passing an object with name-value pairs.

classes.name: DragDropEditPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.DragDropEditPolicy

Called by the framework if the user edit the position of a figure with a drag drop operation. Sub class like SelectionEditPolicy or RegionEditPolicy can adjust the position of the figure or the selections handles.

classes.name: HorizontalEditPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.HorizontalEditPolicy

An EditPolicy for use with Figures. With this edit policy you can move the shape only in a horizontal manner.

functions.description: Creates a new constraint object

classes.name: RegionEditPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.RegionConstraintPolicy

An EditPolicy for use with Figures. The constraint for RegionEditPolicy is a Rectangle. It is not possible to move the related figure outside this constrained area.

functions.name: init
functions.description: Creates a new constraint object

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: x coordinate or a rectangle as constraint for the assigned figure.

functions.name: setBoundingBox
functions.description: Update the constraint bounding box for the policy.

parameters.name: boundingBox
parameters.description: the constraint rectangle

functions.name: adjustPosition
functions.description: Adjust the coordinates to the rectangle/region of this constraint.

functions.name: adjustDimension
functions.description: Adjust the dimension of the rectangle to fit into the region of the policy

functions.name: onInstall
functions.description: Called by the host if the policy has been installed.

functions.name: onUninstall
functions.description: Called by the host if the policy has been uninstalled.

functions.name: onDragStart
functions.description:
Called by the framework if the related shape has init a drag&drop operation

The Policy can send a veto to prevent the DragDrop operation

parameters.description: The host canvas

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: The related figure

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the mouse up event

parameters.name: shiftKey
parameters.description: true if the shift key has been pressed during this event

parameters.name: ctrlKey
parameters.description: true if the ctrl key has been pressed during the event

returns.description: return false to send a veto to the drag operation

functions.description:
Called if the user press the right mouse on the figure.
You can either override the "onContextMenu" method of the figure or install an editor policy and override this method. Booth is valid and possible.

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: the figure below the mouse

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the mouse down event

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the mouse down event

parameters.name: shiftKey
parameters.description: true if the shift key has been pressed during this event

parameters.name: ctrlKey
parameters.description: true if the ctrl key has been pressed during the event

functions.name: attr
functions.description:
Read or set object attributes.
When no value is given, reads specified attribute from the element.
When value is given, sets the attribute to that value. Multiple attributes can be set by passing an object with name-value pairs.

classes.name: ResizeSelectionFeedbackPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.ResizeSelectionFeedbackPolicy

Selection feedback policy without "marching ant lines" or any other rectangle highlight. Just some resize handles at each corner of the shape.

classes.name: SelectionFeedbackPolicy
classes.description:
draw2d.policy.figure.SelectionFeedbackPolicy

A {@link draw2d.policy.SelectionFeedbackPolicy} that is sensitive to the canvas selection. Subclasses will typically decorate the {@link draw2d.Figure figure} with things like selection handles and/or focus feedback.
If you want to change the handle visibility for a figure, then you should use SelectionFeedbackPolicy to do that.

parameters.name: figure
parameters.description: the unselected figure

classes.name: WidthSelectionFeedbackPolicy
classes.description: draw2d.policy.figure.WidthSelectionFeedbackPolicy This selection shows only selection handles for the width. It is only possible to change the width of an shaped. The height stays always the same or is recalculated by the figure itself.
